features: EXCEPTIONAL DESIGN: The 12-inch nonstick skillet has sloped sides which deliver perfect performance and maximize cooking surface. The hard anodized is harder than stainless steel and is dense, nonporous and highly wear-resistant for extra durability and professional performance. Tapered slopes also provide a drip-free pour

COOKING AND CLEANING: Proprietary Quantanium nonstick interior is reinforced with titanium and provides lasting food release, healthily nonfat cooking option, and easy clean up. You really have endless cooking possibilities with the help of unsurpassed heat distribution, that will heat up quickly and spread evenly. Oven safe up to 500 degrees F
EXCEPTIONAL HANDLING: This piece has a cool grip handle which are solid stainless steel riveted stick handles that stay cool on the stove top and provide a safe a solid grip
body.description: Inspired by the French kitchens, Cuisinart began making professional cookware over 30 years ago. Constructed of the finest materials available to perfectly perform all of the classic cooking techniques, Cuisinart continues its commitment to superior quality and innovation. Cuisinart Chef's Classic Non-Stick Hard Anodized skillets have sloped sides and wide flat bottoms for frying, sautéing, or browning. An extremely durable exterior with a smooth, hard anodized finish creates a look of professional elegance to complement any kitchen. Designed from the inside out for today's healthy lifestyles, this collection is constructed with 100% aluminum-free Quantanium nonstick cooking surface reinforced with titanium.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Cuisinart Chef's Classic Nonstick The 12" Nonstick Skillet with Glass Cover is the perfect, large nonstick skillet for a crowd-pleasing paella, risotto, or beef stroganoff. The attractive glass cover locks in flavors, allows for easy simmering, and displays the tempting dish inside!

Features - Unsurpassed Heat Distribution - Drip-Free Pouring - Rim is tapered for drip-free pouring - Cool Grip Handle, Solid stainless steel riveted handle stays cool on the stovetop - Great for slowly cooking minced garlic in olive oil, frying breaded pork chops, or browning sausage - Hard Anodized Exterior. Hard anodized construction heats quickly and spreads heat evenly. Eliminates hot spots - Sloped sides deliver perfect performance. The sloped sides of the skillet maximize cooking surface. Skillets are designed for browning and tossing small pieces of food like mushrooms - Cookware exterior is harder than stainless steel for durability and professional performance. Dense, non-porous, highly wear resistant - Quantanium Non-Stick for Professional Results Quantanium nonstick cooking surface is reinforced with titanium for lasting food release, healthy cooking and easy cleanup. Metal utensil safe

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This shallow nonstick skillet is now the favorite in our well-stocked kitchen for many cooking tasks. The gently sloping sides are great for sauteing, frying bacon, and many other uses, and it is also easy to clean. The metal is thick and heavy enough to heat uniformly. We like it so much that we bought a second one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a replacement for the same pan I've been using for years. The non stick coating lasts a very long time when used correctly. It's the perfect size for stove top dishes I love to cook. It's heavy duty, meaning the weight is heavy, but not too heavy to handle. The only change is the new model is a slight difference in the shape of the handle. I love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice pan
reviews.reviewText: Large enough for French toast and egss all in pan! Love ease of clean up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great pan for the money
reviews.reviewText: I use this pan daily. This is a replacement for one I bought 3 years ago. After substantial use the pan will lose some of its coating, and as I said I use it daily so it lasted longer than I thought. Hand wash for longevity.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works extremely well
reviews.reviewText: I got this for my mom for Christmas and my brother occasionally uses it too. They both say it is an awesome new addition and beats all of the other cooking utensils in the house

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazingly non-stick, cooks quickly
reviews.reviewText: I've had other non-stick pans, but this one is so much better than those, they don't even belong in the same category. I still use a little olive oil when I cook -- habit -- but I think that's not really necessary. Even when the food starts to burn, it doesn't stick.RE: food starts to burn -- this pan cooks so much faster, and at lower heat, that it took some adjustments to my cooking. This pan cooks well with about 2/3rds the amount of heat as my other pans, in about 2/3rds the time. Now that I've figured all that out, I hardly ever burn the meat. <grin>My only quibble is no vent hole in the lid. However, I just stick a spoon along the side, and let the lid rest on the spoon handle, creating a vent gap that way.Cleanup is a breeze. I wipe the pan with a damp paper towel as soon as I put the food on the plate, just to get rid of the leftover oil, sauce, whatever. (Probably not necessary, but I'd rather throw that stuff in the trash than run it down the drain.) When the pan is cool, I set it in the sink, add a few drops of dish liquid, fill it with water, and let it set for a while. I go back later and use a dishcloth or paper towel to rub the surface of the pan with the soapy water, rinse, and it's done. There's been no scrubbing necessary. (Maybe if I burned something to a crisp, but I haven't done that.)I bought the 8-inch skillet for single-person meals (4 oz meat) and the 12-inch skillet for family-sized meals (1 lb. meat). I like them so much that I've just ordered the 11-inch flat griddle; I expect it'll make reheating leftover pizza much easier. These pans are absolutely wonderful, and I highly recommend them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pan at Great Value
reviews.reviewText: My previous old teflon pan saw its last days. Looked at the reviews and opted for this one and haven't been disappointed. Its heavy enough to evenly distribute the heat with no hot spots which is a real plus with omelets. I've yet to have anything stick and cleanup has been just a wipe clean and no scrubbing. So far the surface has resisted marring and scratching (use silicone utensils). I give this item two thumbs up and worth the price.
Me encantó este sarten, no se pega para nada y tampoco quema nada y ya llevo con el casi 7 meses, además, tiene un muy buen tamaño. Recomendado al 100%
Excelente compra. No se pega nada, super facil de limpiar. Cualquier cosa se puede cocinar sin aceite. Durará años!
Can cook a large amount of anything and cleans up in a blink. Great value.
Excelente calidad y producto lo recomiendo ampliamente , su tamaño es perfecto y la tapa es muy resistente

reviews.reviewTitle: Really is a solid non-stick pan
reviews.reviewText: This is a really good non-stick frypan. I bought their crepe pan first which was brilliant, it kept getting used instead of our regular frypan, so I have bought the big brother version.
